030e3287-54d9-4592-a469-b3cb6ef635d7.description: Earners of this NACCE Certified Member College badge certifies two and four year college institutions as leaders in entrepreneurship education.This college and institution engages their community and ecosystem through their entrepreneurial efforts. They leverage NACCE's initiatives in professional development, best practices, technical assistance resources, and research.
030e3287-54d9-4592-a469-b3cb6ef635d7.name: NACCE Certifed Member College

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: This is the best membership option for colleges or business support organizations. Within this membership full benefits are provided for up to (10) professionals and the president, for a total of (11) members.
NACCE certified members have access to funding, grant, and technical assistance opportunities.  These monetary opportunities are in addition to exclusive member benefits.

c6019e9e-c86a-43d6-ae66-bd678aea53f4.description: Earners of the Verizon Innovative Learning Certified Stem Student Badge have completed a 3 week camp and academic year of face to face hands on stem curriculum at their participating college campus. A project based curriculum including focused areas of AR/VR, 3D printing, coding, robotics, innovation and the 10 UN Sustainability Goals are the completion targets of the academic targets.
c6019e9e-c86a-43d6-ae66-bd678aea53f4.name: Verizon Innovative Learning Certified STEM Student

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: Arizona State University
alignments.description: The curriculum is created by the Arizona State University educational team and vetted and approved by the Verizon Foundation .

badge_template_activities.title: Played an active role in learning the stem curriculum and demonstrated an eagerness to learn, engage, create and collaborate with their peers. This student is driven to innovate and positively impact others.
Complete attendance for summer camp and academic Saturday engagements and complete group presentation with fellow students.

Each student must complete an application as part of the registration process. 80% of the students must qualify for the federal free and reduced lunch program. Male students are predominately from urban communities and female students are predominately from rural communities.

6363873c-c8ec-40fa-8cbe-349e871b9679.description: Make/SHIFT is an annual maker-focused event that leverages best practices in teaching maker and entrepreneurial mindsets that drive soft skills highly sought after by many employers. Participants will learn how to build an inclusive culture of innovation and develop productive partnerships while preparing students for careers by utilizing proven entrepreneurial makerspace models.
6363873c-c8ec-40fa-8cbe-349e871b9679.name: We Are Makers

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all make/SHIFT virtual sessions taking place daily during the event dates.
Complete all surveys & engagement opportunities provided after each session. A survey link will be posted.
Participate in 3 of the 5 networking sessions.

ca79641b-cb59-42dd-82ee-c17aa7dc78be.description: The earners of the Intuit Design Thinking Innovator badge have developed design thinking skills to creatively solve problems and lead with an innovative mindset. They are competent in creative thinking, innovative problem solving, empathy, ideation, and applying rapid experimentation to test solutions.
ca79641b-cb59-42dd-82ee-c17aa7dc78be.name: Intuit Design Thinking Innovator

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE & Intuit, Inc Partnership
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge. This is also recognized by Intuit, Inc.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8 hours of Design Thinking training that focuses on 3 core principles - Deep Customer Empathy, Go Broad to Go Narrow, and Rapid Experiments.
Submit short project plan outlining plans for leveraging design thinking with students.
The Implementation of Design Thinking activity with students in the classroom.

4937d804-d720-4597-b4b9-7947b0d7877e.description: The earner of the In Lab Innovator in Residence (IIR) training will develop skills related to design thinking. The IIR is an intensive applied learning training program offered through a combination of activities that mirrors quality professional learning standards.
4937d804-d720-4597-b4b9-7947b0d7877e.name: InLab Innovator In Residence

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

alignments.name: HCC InLab Certified
alignments.description: The InLab at HCC certifies completion and eligibility of badge recipients.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the In Lab Innovator in Residence training course successfully. This training will be delivered over a 3 week period in high impact, live synchronous sessions.

Participants of the course will apply design thinking and entrepreneurial mindset methods to their classrooms, schools, and community. Tracking of implementation and implementation methods and the sharing of experiences and best practices will be completed via monthly calls.

skills.name: Pitching And Communicating A Business Idea

c22ccdd7-3b83-4224-9f90-ea4d48ea9266.description: SHIFT Your Teaching Style to Facilitation & Experiential Learning. Join us for this interactive workshop and explore ways that you can turn your classroom (regardless of academic discipline) into an Innovation Lab! You will gain facilitation strategies that help your students to identify problems, ideate on solutions, test approaches, and co-create with each other. This badge is given through participation at NACCE's 2021 make/SHIFT Pre-Conference Session.
c22ccdd7-3b83-4224-9f90-ea4d48ea9266.name: NACCE Certified Experiential Teacher

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: This badge is given through participation at NACCE's 2021 make/SHIFT Pre-Conference Session.

771d44ba-61c0-418f-aae0-cabd87445375.description: Earners of the EEVF Innovator certification have developed the skills needed to launch the Everyday Entrepreneur Venture Fund (EEVF) at their college, and have proven ability to innovate and embrace the entrepreneurial spirit through the onboarding process. EEVF Innovators are competent in skills such as entrepreneurial mindset, design thinking, fundraising, committee management, program leadership, project management and more.
771d44ba-61c0-418f-aae0-cabd87445375.name: EEVF Innovator

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: EEVF Steering Committee Approved
alignments.description: The EEVF Steering Committee approves and verifies this badge.

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete EEVF trainings and related reflection/action assignments supporting developing, engaging and managing a funding committee; leveraging college, community, and NACCE resources; fundraising, the case for giving, and local gift matching; and developing your small business pipeline and preparing students for success.

Construct a Funding Committee and program plan customized to the needs and resources available to the participating college and community. Engage local stakeholders, and define roles and project benchmarks, and employ skills learned in the EEVF Professional Development series.
Create a networking hub on the Startup Space Platform.

skills.name: Pitching And Communicating A Business Idea

051a89a1-36f1-4bf8-b534-60a6cd95d25d.description: Earners of this badge have an increased awareness in global entrepreneurship after completing the focused design thinking workshop and discussion. They know the importance and relevance of entrepreneurship from a global perspective, and have demonstrated the ability to bring global entrepreneurship to their local communities. They also learned about impact opportunities surrounding Global Entrepreneurship education and how to leverage the UN Sustainability Development Goals.
051a89a1-36f1-4bf8-b534-60a6cd95d25d.name: Global Entrepreneurship Catalyst

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Engage in Design Thinking Activity by participating and contributing in all topics, discussions, and practice. NACCE is encouraging previewing these two videos to help with your engagement in the activities: Global Center of Practice Launch and UNESCO's knowledge jam.  Videos can be found on the events page.

Join and contribute to the Global Entrepreneurship Discussion group in NACCE Meets.  Initiate the conversation by sharing the college's plan or vision to engage more community members on this initiative.

4f106a6f-88a8-4d79-a103-abf5e7995ac3.description: The earner of this badge fulfilled the educational requirements of the Entrepreneurship 101 – Cross Disciplinary Teaching & Leadership Best Practices track at the 2020 NACCE National Conference. In addition, this earner has displayed proficient key takeaways, skills, and best practices towards professional development in this higher education focus.
4f106a6f-88a8-4d79-a103-abf5e7995ac3.name: Skilled Entrepreneurship Professional

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the recipient must attend 1 or more sessions within this designated track.
Participate in any discussion group in NACCE Meets.  Share a best practice, learned experience, or key takeaway from any session.
The earner has completed an application in order to receive this badge. Go to the link below and click on the orange bar to access the application.

486603f5-d571-4d51-a51d-c65d873ca6d1.description: Earners of this badge have an increaed awareness of the challenges faced by women in entrepreneurship and entrepreneurial leadership. They know the importance and value of women in entrepreneurship, and are working to enhance the experience of and empower their colleagues and communities.
486603f5-d571-4d51-a51d-c65d873ca6d1.name: Women in Entrepreneurship Advocate

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Engage in a 90-minute workshop the many challenges faced by entrepreneurs and entrepreneurial leaders. Design a prototype during the Design Thinking Workshop, and present your ideas with the group.
Review and reflect upon the Forbes Coaches Council's  "15 Challenges Women Leaders Face and How to Overcome Them." Participate in in-event polls and engagement opportunities.
Contribute to and engage with a network of colleagues who support this work by making recommendations to resources and/or connecting to the NACCE Meets Women in Entrepreneurship Community.

c98ed10b-e570-4fb8-bdbe-e43b6b53b533.description: The earner of this badge fulfilled the educational requirements of the Academic Programs track at the 2020 NACCE National Conference. bccb83d4-bf00-48cb-a44c-e054776b4a8e.description: Earners of the Certified Partner Badge are organizations who collaboratively work with NACCE to achieve a common goal. The expectations of this partnership align with the NACCE mission, vision, and philosophy.

31c35ed1-4a5b-4deb-bea5-7dc8937c0bc8.description: The maker movement is gaining traction on campuses across the nation. However, Innovative ChangeMAKING is a blue ocean of opportunity that encourages participants to explore higher purposes for themselves, their communities, and their institution. This program leverages tools and strategies to holistically promote Innovative ChangeMAKING action techniques. Each module will focus on uncovering hidden opportunities to change on campus and in communities regardless of discipline or department.
31c35ed1-4a5b-4deb-bea5-7dc8937c0bc8.name: Innovative ChangeMAKER

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will complete six modules on an asynchronous learning platform with opportunities to engage with leaders and peers in regularly scheduled monthly, virtual meetings offering TED-style inspiration.

66ecac63-7e62-4049-b0d2-ad186deb9051.description: Earners of the Community Barter Trade Economist badge have developed the skills to engage in peer-to-peer barter trade as well as barter through a trade exchange. Students will acquire the ability to actively build a barter trade commerce community within their community college network, among students, and with nonprofits and small businesses in their area. Benchmarks throughout the course will empower students to create and enhance economic opportunities.
66ecac63-7e62-4049-b0d2-ad186deb9051.name: Community Barter Trade Economist

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete Barter Trade in the New Economy course successfully through assignments, assessements, and activities.
Earners will gain adaptive and hands-on training to build trade commerce within their community.  Skills obtained in this course will arm students to build barter commerce ecosystems.
In partial fullfillment of the course, students will activity participate in the Barter Trade Community of UpliftNow to list, sell, earn, buy, and donate community Trade Tokens.

ed7a69e6-efab-4722-a5b4-0bf32fa1978b.description: The earner of this badge fulfilled the educational requirements from the 2020 NACCE Leadership Summit. In addition, this earner has displayed proficient key takeaways, skills, and best practices towards professional development in this higher education focus.

d38feeec-ec21-43b3-918c-beb11154d9ae.description: Earners of the NACCE/EntreEd Certified Outreach partner are required to complete the 6-hour Outreach Partner Training Course virtually or online as part of EntreEd Academy's academic training programs.
d38feeec-ec21-43b3-918c-beb11154d9ae.name: NACCE/EntreEd Certified Outreach Partner

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Outreach Partner Training Course
Successfully complete the entire 6-hour course and receive completion certification upon final submission via the EntreEd Academy platform.

a1cde0b9-d5c0-4fd2-b7bf-120f5c4fbd92.description: Earners of the Ratcliffe PitchMaster badge are certified as exceptional in their entrepreneurial & creative thinking, communications and public speaking skills. A Ratcliffe PitchMaster engaged in a rigorous, national competition to realistically and uniquely solve educational and community challenges around access, jobs creation and entrepreneurship in the Skilled Trades.
a1cde0b9-d5c0-4fd2-b7bf-120f5c4fbd92.name: Ratcliffe PitchMaster

issuer.summary: issued by National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

entity.name: National Association for Community College Entrepreneurship

alignments.name: NACCE Verified
alignments.description: NACCE Leadership approves and verifies this badge with support from the Pitch for the Trades panel of judges.

alignments.name: Philip E. and Carole R. Ratcliffe Foundation Approved
alignments.description: NACCE's Pitch for the Trades is presented in partnership with the Philip E. and Carole R. Ratcliffe Foundation, who approve this badge.

badge_template_activities.title: Students have to have successfully completed and have scored in the top tier in rounds 1 and 2 of competition.
Top teams from round 1 and 2, qualifiers must successfully pitch in round 3 and score in the top tier of the rubric.  Top teams must be graded higher or equal to good on the judge score card.

PitchMasters demonstrated their ability to communicate, think entrepreneurially, and connect with an audience by pitching in three rounds of competition with judging review and won a monetary prize in the Pitch for the Trades competition.
